com.ace.lewissketch
Interface LewisConstants

All Known Implementing Classes:
Atom, Bond, Electrons, Graph, LewisSketch, LsActionListener, LsCanvas, LsMouseListener, LsUtils, MinMax, Molecule, MoleculeToMol, MolToMolecule, MolToXML, Octants, Scalable
interface LewisConstants

Package-wide constants. Many were determined empirically for aesthetic reasons (it just looked right when displayed on the screen!)

Constant Field Values

N

static final int N
Directional constant used to index bondCount[] and electronCount[] arrays as well as identify a particular octant. N is down on the MarvinSketch canvas!

UNDEFINED_OCTANT

static final int UNDEFINED_OCTANT
No direction defined for an octant.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ELECTRON_WIDTH

static final int ELECTRON_WIDTH
Constant for drawing lone electrons. A "shell" is a circle of electrons around an atom. When more than one shell is needed, they are concentric circles with an increasing radius. Constant values were determined empirically (they look good when displayed).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ELECTRONS_PER_SHELL

static final int ELECTRONS_PER_SHELL
Constant for drawing lone electrons. A "shell" is a circle of electrons around an atom. When more than one shell is needed, they are concentric circles with an increasing radius. Constant values were determined empirically (they look good when displayed).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

ELECTRON_SEPARATION

static final int ELECTRON_SEPARATION
Constant for drawing lone electrons. A "shell" is a circle of electrons around an atom. When more than one shell is needed, they are concentric circles with an increasing radius. Constant values were determined empirically (they look good when displayed).

See Also:
Constant Field Values

BASE_SHELL_RADIUS

static final int BASE_SHELL_RADIUS
Constant for drawing lone electrons. A "shell" is a circle of electrons around an atom. When more than one shell is needed, they are concentric circles with an increasing radius. Constant values were determined empirically (they look good when displayed).

SHELL_SEPARATION

static final int SHELL_SEPARATION
Constant for drawing lone electrons. A "shell" is a circle of electrons around an atom. When more than one shell is needed, they are concentric circles with an increasing radius. Constant values were determined empirically (they look good when displayed).
